description.narrative: Australia considers the Commonwealth Secretariat (ComSec)'s democracy work one of its key strengths, as highlighted in the 2018 Multilateral Performance Assessment of ComSec. Funds will serve two key purposes: (i) building capacity of member countries to engage in inclusive and constructive dialogue with national stakeholders, with a view to resolving political impasses, achieving consensus on major issues affecting the credibility of elections, and in engaging in conflict prevention throughout the electoral cycle; and (ii) assisting member countries to develop and implement strategies, through consultation with national stakeholders and drawing on good international practice, to address the barriers limiting the participation of women in politics. The total value of this investment is $1.0 million to be expensed over the 2017-18 and 2018-19 financial years.
